articles.headline: Fed Projects Patience Even as Economic Outlook Brightens
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve’s economic estimates show rates at near zero for years, along with faster growth and higher inflation.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve’s economic estimates show rates at near zero for years, along with faster growth and higher inflation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials signaled on Wednesday that they are in no rush to dial back support for a pandemic-damaged economy, releasing a fresh set of projections that showed the central bank’s policy interest rate on hold at near zero for years to come — even as the outlook rapidly improves.

articles.headline: Trust in AstraZeneca Vaccine Is Shaken in Europe
articles.snippet: The European Medicines Agency seems likely to pronounce the shot safe. But will anyone want to take it after this week’s panic?
articles.abstract: The European Medicines Agency seems likely to pronounce the shot safe. But will anyone want to take it after this week’s panic?
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — It’s said that the European Union grows stronger through crises. The bloc’s attempt at a coordinated vaccination program, less a rollout than a roller coaster, has tested that theory, and now the suspension of the AstraZeneca shots in many countries threatens to turn widespread disarray into an outright debacle.

articles.headline: As Biden and Xi Begin a Careful Dance, a New American Policy Takes Shape
articles.snippet: Top administration officials will meet with their Chinese counterparts for the first time on Thursday as the United States shifts to a more competitive posture with Beijing.
articles.abstract: Top administration officials will meet with their Chinese counterparts for the first time on Thursday as the United States shifts to a more competitive posture with Beijing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden is engineering a sharp shift in policy toward China, focused on gathering allies to counter Beijing’s coercive diplomacy around the world and ensuring that China does not gain a permanent advantage in critical technologies.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Michael Crowley

articles.headline: The Growing Power of Asian-Americans in Georgia Now Comes With Fear
articles.snippet: The killing of eight people in Atlanta and suburban Cherokee County has come amid a rising tide of anti-Asian incidents nationwide.
articles.abstract: The killing of eight people in Atlanta and suburban Cherokee County has come amid a rising tide of anti-Asian incidents nationwide.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Alex Wan moved to Atlanta in 1971, he was the only student of Asian descent in his class. His grandmother grew Chinese cabbage and melons in their garden because there was nowhere close to buy them. There was no Chinese church, so services were held in people’s homes.

articles.headline: Suspect in Atlanta Spa Attacks Is Charged With 8 Counts of Murder
articles.snippet: Six of the eight people killed were women of Asian descent, setting off a new wave of outrage and fear.
articles.abstract: Six of the eight people killed were women of Asian descent, setting off a new wave of outrage and fear.
articles.lead_paragraph: ACWORTH, Ga. — A gunman’s rampage that killed eight people, including six women of Asian descent, in the Atlanta area this week has set off a new wave of fear and outrage among Asian-Americans, coming in a year of anti-Asian violence across the country.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset, Campbell Robertson, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Sean Keenan

articles.headline: Amazon Says It Pays Alabama Workers Well; Other Local Employers Pay More
articles.snippet: Recent organizing campaigns in the South suggest the company’s wage scale may have left it vulnerable to a union.
articles.abstract: Recent organizing campaigns in the South suggest the company’s wage scale may have left it vulnerable to a union.
articles.lead_paragraph: In making the case against a union at its warehouse in Bessemer, Ala., Amazon has touted its compensation package. The company notes that base pay at the facility, around $15.50 an hour for most rank-and-file workers, is more than twice the local minimum wage, and that it offers comprehensive health insurance and retirement benefits.

articles.headline: Penny Stocks Are Booming, Which Is Good News for Swindlers
articles.snippet: Retail investors see the tiny companies as the next big opportunity after meme stocks and cryptocurrency. But shares are an easy target for fraud.
articles.abstract: Retail investors see the tiny companies as the next big opportunity after meme stocks and cryptocurrency. But shares are an easy target for fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: It didn’t look like a very promising investment opportunity.

articles.headline: ‘A Perfect World’ Around Every Miniature Bend
articles.snippet: The pandemic has helped Märklin, a 162-year-old company that makes model trains, discover a new audience.
articles.abstract: The pandemic has helped Märklin, a 162-year-old company that makes model trains, discover a new audience.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Last spring, the managers at Märklin, the 162-year-old maker of model trains in Germany, were surprised by something unexpected in the sales reports.

articles.headline: Why Are Jobless Claims Still High? For Some, It’s the Multiple Layoffs.
articles.snippet: A California study shows the extent of dependence on benefits over the last year and how many people have shuttled in and out of work.
articles.abstract: A California study shows the extent of dependence on benefits over the last year and how many people have shuttled in and out of work.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jobs are coming back. Businesses are reopening. But a year after the pandemic jolted the economy, applications for unemployment benefits remain stubbornly, shockingly high — higher on a weekly basis than at any point in any previous recession, by some measures.

articles.headline: U.S. to Send Millions of Vaccine Doses to Mexico and Canada
articles.snippet: The announcement came at a time when the Biden administration has been quietly pressing Mexico to ramp up its efforts to limit the flow of migrants.
articles.abstract: The announcement came at a time when the Biden administration has been quietly pressing Mexico to ramp up its efforts to limit the flow of migrants.
articles.lead_paragraph: The United States plans to send millions of doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine to Mexico and Canada, the White House said Thursday, a notable step into vaccine diplomacy just as the Biden administration is quietly pressing Mexico to curb the stream of migrants coming to the border.
articles.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff, Maria Abi-Habib, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Jim Tankersley
